intro: Lomatium orogenioides, commonly known as the mountain lomatium, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and flowering heads. It is native to the Pacific Northwest of North America, particularly in mountainous regions of Washington and Oregon. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are small and clustered in umbrella-like inflorescences. Lomatium orogenioides is often used in traditional herbal medicine and is valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
